reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A truly terrifying novel set in space
reviews.reviewText: Dead Shock is ferociously dark tale of the things that go bump in the night, turned up to 11! I absolutely loved this novel! It reminded me of some of the scariest things I’ve ever experienced in any medium, particularly that unmitigated champion of terror in space—for me, anyway—the deliciously frightening PC game, Dead Space. And Dead Shock brings all those marvelous memories pouring back and adds plenty of its own new ones, as well. This is simply one very scary novel!But even the greatest tale of horror in space (my favorite genre within a genre) would be just okay without the requisite amount of skill in prose, narrative and character development to make it all come to life in a plausible, convincing way. Mr. Henry delivers beautifully here too. His characters are believable and lifelike; some honorable, likable and pleasing, others selfish, repulsive and disgusting—just like in life. His descriptions and writing style are similarly excellent and his insights into human nature really make the suspension of disbelief so much easier.If you’re into space horror and love a well-constructed and terrifying story that lets you go traipsing through some of the most hellacious places you’ve never been with abominations that are guaranteed to send a chill up and down your spine, then you couldn’t do better that to give this masterpiece of horror in space a try.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars idea is interesting but I got lost
reviews.reviewText: I like the idea but I feel like there could have been more world building or descriptors. Some scenes I had no idea how the UG ship was laid out or how the crew space walked or how the begining chase scene played out I was lost either the design of both ships in general but I do like the premise of the book

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Decent Sci-Fi Horror Read
reviews.reviewText: I'm not sure why people are put off by a cliffhanger in this novel. I figured a cliffhanger would happen based on this book being the first in the series. My biggest gripe is the editing could be tighter. Between some wrong word choices and minor typos, I removed one star. These issues weren't enough to take me out of the story or ruin my experience.Admittedly, I'm not a fan of the doctor, Coulson. He appears a little too forced. Think like Dr. McCoy on Star Trek, but times 100. He has an abrasive attitude and no real reason he acts that way. But maybe that's what Wallace Henry was shooting for.But, that's just my taste in characters and in no way ruins the story.Just a heads up, it gets fairly graphic. And sometimes, it gets a little bizarre, especially with the eclectic mix of aliens and monsters.Brief plot overview: A diplomat for a government-run organization checks on a massive space station holding an entire country's worth of people. When the space station goes radio silent, the diplomat has to take a team in to find out the issue. They arrive to find the place overrun by weird space mutants, piles of dead bodies, and a phantom dictatorship that created a cult-like atmosphere.I'm already in the second book and can safely say business really picks up. Looking forward to finishing out the series.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2020
reviews.reviewText: Really well done! The characters are believable and the situations feel real. Def very creepy too but in a demonic and interesting way. Def keep the series going!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Totally fragmented storyline
reviews.reviewText: Several times the story just shifted, like the author forgot where he left off and just said, screw it, I’ll just pick it up over here, with no good explanation on how we got there. Also, this isn’t much oh a Part 1, it’s more like just half a story, short and incomplete. I’ll read book 2 just because I feel after struggling through book 1 and not getting an ending.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Doom, Event Horizon, and Resident Evil had a baby
reviews.reviewText: Take just about every horror, space, and Sci fi movie, toss them in a blender, and this is what you get. Overall pretty good book. Gore and horror abound. The main character isn't all that likeable and seems to zone out whenever there is a fight. I'm interested to see what happens to him in the next book. There's a few editing errors. There's also several times where the author just seems to ignore certain characters. One character just seems to appear every so often when she's needed for a conversation. She's with the group but hardly ever mentioned. There's a group of new characters towards the end, but only one of them is described. Once a fight starts, they aren't mentioned at all. I'm not sure if this was a first draft or there was a ton of stuff cut out, but it just seems like some needed background info or other sentences are missing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Not worth the time
reviews.reviewText: Characters are the worst stereotypes. The setup is ludicrous. I didn't make it past the 4th chapter. Save your money and time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2020
reviews.reviewText: Pretty good. I like the space zombies. Character background and context is a good opportunity to buy in, that is, they are flawed, but adequately sympathetic. I feel like there’s snippets of Doom, Dawn of the Dead, and several other shows included borrowed, but I don’t mind. So...enjoyable story. Thanks

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Brilliant story, well rounded characters and easy to read.
